notes: Human-in-the-loop Codex mission that mirrors the automated clone smoke workflow (bundle tools + qdrant install/remove).

tasks.prompt: Use the sandbox MCP proxy to 1) run tools/list and confirm workspace_fs_read, grep, doc_fetch_suite, and manage_stelae are published, 2) call workspace_fs_read with {"operation":"read_file","path":"README.md"}, 3) call grep with {"pattern":"manage_stelae","paths":["README.md"],"recursive":false,"regexp":false}, and 4) call doc_fetch_suite with {"operation":"list_documentation_sources_tool"}. Summarize what you learned and do not run shell commands.

Install the qdrant MCP descriptor under the alias qdrant_smoke via manage_stelae. Call manage_stelae with {"operation":"install_server","params":{"name":"qdrant","target_name":"qdrant_smoke","force":true}}, wait for completion, then issue a read-only verification call (e.g., list_discovered_servers). Capture the call IDs and note whether the restart completed cleanly.

Remove the qdrant_smoke alias via manage_stelae with {"operation":"remove_server","params":{"name":"qdrant_smoke","force":true}}. Confirm the server no longer appears in discovery, then update manual_result.json with status='passed', the install/remove call IDs, and any notes about the session.
